title: Trump's 50% tariffs: Will India budge on Russia crude oil trade? Explained
content: Donald Trump's doubled tariffs on India, targeting its Russian oil trade, aim to pressure Putin on the Ukraine war. India faces a complex balancing act between maintaining ties with Russia and the US, its largest trading partner. While India may gradually reduce Russian oil dependency, a complete shift is unlikely due to economic and political considerations.

title: 'Vote theft' row: EC ups the ante, asks Rahul to sign oath; Cong MP hits back
content: The Karnataka Election Commission has demanded Congress leader Rahul Gandhi provide a formal declaration and names of allegedly wrongfully included electors to support his "vote theft" claim. The poll body emphasized the transparent preparation of electoral rolls, stating election results can only be challenged via an Election Petition in High Court.

title: 'Idhar hi maar isko': Virat Kohli and KL Rahul's fired-up advice
content: During the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Harshit Rana engaged in a fiery exchange with Mitchell Starc, dismissing him after a barrage of bouncers. Virat Kohli and KL Rahul egged Rana on from the slips, adding fuel to the contest. Starc retaliated later, hitting Rana on the helmet, but the young pacer took it in good spirit.

title: Intel CEO should resign immediately, no other solution as he is Highly ..., says Donald Trump
content: Donald Trump has urged Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan to resign immediately, citing a significant conflict of interest. This demand follows Senator Tom Cotton's letter to Intel's board, questioning Tan's alleged ties to Chinese firms and their potential impact on US national security. Intel's shares experienced a 5% drop in premarket trading following Trump's statement.

title: Trump tariffs: How India is planning to cushion affected sectors
content: In response to the US's increased tariffs on Indian goods, the government is considering targeted support for sectors like textiles and chemicals. The export promotion mission, with a budget of Rs 2,250 crore, may offer easy credit, overseas warehousing, and global branding to help exporters find new markets.

title: 'Can't act like a crook': SC orders ED to work 'within law'; flags low conviction rate
content: The Supreme Court has cautioned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against overreach, emphasizing adherence to the law. Justices highlighted concerns about ED's low conviction rate despite numerous cases registered. The court's remarks came during a hearing on petitions reviewing the ED's powers under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to youngsters: I believe that best employees are...
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, now a billionaire, emphasizes the importance of self-criticism and embracing discomfort for professional growth. He encourages Gen Z to pursue their passions and work with individuals who challenge their abilities. Pichai's management philosophy centers on building mission-oriented teams driven by a shared pursuit of excellence, fostering an environment of trust and commitment.

title: No horses, no band: Groom sets out on boat to bride's village - Watch video
content: In Ballia, a groom took a boat to his wedding. The Ganga river was flooded. Roads were underwater. The wedding procession decided to travel by boat. They did not want to postpone the event. The groom reached the bride's village by boat. Locals said the wedding date was fixed. A video of the boat procession went viral.

title: EC vs Cong: Rahul shows 5 ways 'votes were stolen' - what 'proof' was given?
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of India of electoral malpractices during the recent polls. Gandhi presented documents claiming to show over 100,000 stolen votes in a single assembly constituency. The alleged irregularities include duplicate voters, fake addresses, bulk voters at single addresses, invalid photos, and misuse of Form 6.

title: An entire country is shifting to Australia, as first planned migration is underway
content: Tuvalu, a Pacific island nation, faces imminent submersion due to rising sea levels, prompting a groundbreaking planned migration. A treaty with Australia allows 280 Tuvaluans annually to gain permanent residency, accessing essential services.

title: Happy Raksha Bandhan 2025: Best Rakhi Wishes and messages
content: Raksha Bandhan 2025 is approaching. This festival celebrates the bond between siblings. Sisters tie a Rakhi on their brother's wrist. The festival's origin dates back to Lord Krishna and Draupadi. In 2025, Raksha Bandhan will be celebrated on August 9. The article provides Rakhi wishes for brothers and sisters. It also suggests gift ideas.

title: Chess | The Mother’s Gambit: How one trick raised a champion at 8
content: Tanishka Garg, an eight-year-old from Bathinda, has become Punjab's youngest female FIDE-rated chess player, showcasing her strategic talent at a young age. Her journey began unexpectedly when she joined her brother's coaching sessions, quickly surpassing expectations and winning multiple titles.

title: Brushing teeth at night and its link with heart attacks: 3 things to know
content: A recent Japanese study suggests that skipping nighttime teeth brushing may increase the risk of cardiovascular events. Oral bacteria can multiply overnight due to reduced saliva flow, potentially entering the bloodstream and causing inflammation. While not a direct cause, good oral hygiene, especially at night, correlates with better health outcomes, including fewer cardiac events.

title: Jaz Agassi’s sweet support for dad Andre Agassi — Steffi Graf moment resurfaces
content: Andre Agassi addressed Shore Capital Partner’s Leadership Academy in New York City on July 14, 2025, emphasizing leadership, mindset, and purpose. Following the fireside chat with Jish Bia, Agassi's daughter, Jaz, expressed her admiration on Instagram. Agassi has previously discussed parenting and his efforts to break negative cycles, highlighting his and Steffi Graf's influence on their children.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's shot nearly sends camera crew to the hospital
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old cricket prodigy, known for his explosive batting, recently stunned a Rajasthan Royals promotional shoot. His powerful straight drive narrowly missed the camera crew, highlighting both his raw talent and the potential danger of his shots.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Salman's bodyguard's father passes away, Kajol fumes at paparazzi & more
content: Bollywood is abuzz with news as Tanuja's spirited whistle for Kajol delights fans, while Shera mourns the loss of his father. Ahaan Panday vows dedication after 'Saiyaara' success, and Sanjay Leela Bhansali plans a 'Love & War' first look. Kajol's reaction to a Hindi request at an event sparks debate, highlighting diverse moments in the entertainment world.

title: Trump urges Middle East peace via Abraham Accords, says Iran nukes ‘gone’
content: Donald Trump has urged all Middle Eastern nations to join the Abraham Accords, emphasizing its importance for regional peace. He also claimed that Iran's nuclear arsenal has been eliminated, though this assertion lacks independent verification. The call comes amid ongoing tensions and efforts to foster dialogue in the Middle East.

title: EU sanctions hit Nayara logistics as shipping lines pull back; seeks government help
content: Nayara Energy faces severe fuel supply disruptions as shipowners halt operations due to EU sanctions linked to its Russian ownership. This forces the company to seek government assistance for alternative shipping solutions to maintain fuel distribution to key Indian demand centers.

title: ‘Sink City, Koodagram’: Hooda takes shot at BJP govt over Gurugram’s urban woes
content: Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda criticized the BJP-led Haryana government for Gurugram's deteriorating civic infrastructure, labeling it a "sink city" and "Koodagram" during a Parliament session. He highlighted issues like waterlogging and sewage mismanagement, alleging stagnation in infrastructure projects initiated during the Congress tenure. Hooda challenged the government to acknowledge the problems and take corrective action.

title: Magic Johnson's comment on Stephen Curry’s mother once broke internet
content: Magic Johnson congratulated Stephen Curry on his award. His tweet about hanging out with Sonya Curry, Stephen's mother, stirred controversy. Many found the comment unnecessary. Sonya Curry did not respond to the tweet. However, she made Johnson emotional on her show, 'Raising Fame'. Johnson cried during a video call with his mother on the show.

title: 'Certain conditions': Putin explains why he won't meet Zelenskyy
content: Vladimir Putin stated that the conditions for direct talks with Volodymyr Zelenskyy are not yet in place, despite Zelenskyy's willingness. Putin is open to meeting Zelenskyy only at the final stage of negotiations. Meanwhile, Putin is expected to visit India by the end of 2025 and may meet with Donald Trump in the UAE next week.

title: ‘Will our citizenship be taken?’: Mamata attacks Centre; BJP hits back
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP-led central government of plotting to deprive citizens of their rights by revising the voter list, alleging a scheme to label Indians as Rohingyas and deport them. Banerjee criticized the Election Commission for bias and vowed to protest any removal of genuine voters.

title: US-Russia talks: Trump, Putin to meet next week; UAE likely venue
content: The Kremlin announced that a meeting between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin is expected as early as next week, potentially in the United Arab Emirates. This meeting comes as Trump seeks to pressure Russia on trade and resolve the ongoing conflict in Ukraine.

title: Travis Kelce era fading: Andy Reid taps Noah Gray; Chiefs’ TE future takes shape
content: Kansas City Chiefs are preparing for the future as coach Andy Reid names Noah Gray as Travis Kelce's likely successor at training camp. Despite Kelce's ongoing performance and contract, the team acknowledges his eventual retirement. Gray, with the team since 2021, is showing promise, building on a strong 2024 season.

title: Earthquake risk in Canada! Yukon fault shows signs of awakening after 12,000 years
content: A recent study confirms that Canada's Tintina fault, stretching across Yukon, is an active seismic hazard, challenging previous assumptions. Scientists warn that the fault is overdue for a major earthquake, potentially magnitude 7.5 or greater. The discovery prompts urgent updates to Canada's National Seismic Hazard Model, impacting building codes and emergency preparedness.

title: VP elections: PM Modi, Nadda to pick candidate; NDA leaders hold key huddle
content: Following Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation, the NDA convened a crucial strategy meeting on Wednesday to deliberate on the upcoming Vice-Presidential election. Authorizing Prime Minister Modi and BJP president Nadda to finalize their candidate, the alliance unanimously passed a resolution. Kiren Rijiju announced the election timeline, setting August 21 as the nomination deadline and September 9 for polling and counting.

title: 5 India stars of Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy who could miss the Asia Cup
content: Despite India's Test dominance against England, several key players from the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy are set to miss the Asia Cup. Jasprit Bumrah is rested due to workload, while KL Rahul is overlooked despite a strong IPL. Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill are committed to the Duleep Trophy, and Rishabh Pant is injured and out of contention.

title: CBSE launches new career dashboard and counseling hub
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education introduces two initiatives for the 2025-26 session. These are the Career Guidance Dashboard and the Counseling Hub and Spoke School Model. The Career Guidance Dashboard offers career information and exploration tools. The Counseling Hub and Spoke Model aims to support students' emotional and mental health. These programs will evolve with stakeholder input.

title: NCERT forms expert panel to review Class 8 map after feedback on Maratha Empire depiction
content: NCERT has formed an expert committee to review textbook content following concerns about a Class 8 social science textbook. The dispute arose from a map depicting parts of Rajasthan under the Maratha Empire, which was contested by historians. NCERT emphasizes that the review aligns with the National Education Policy 2020, ensuring academic integrity and transparency through evidence-based decisions.

title: Fortnite downtime begins: Chapter 6 Season 4 update disrupts servers
content: Fortnite Chapter 6 Season 4, "Shock 'N Awesome," is about to begin, following a typical downtime that lasts from August 7, 2025, at 2 AM ET. Players are met with a mechanical insectoid invasion led by Daigo's Kraken and a road that brings other Fortnite game mechanics like Mighty Morphin Power Rangers to life!

title: ‘Starship flight to Mars crewed by Optimus in Nov/Dec next year’: Elon Musk
content: Elon Musk has adjusted SpaceX's Mars mission timeline, pushing back the potential Starship launch to 2028 for an uncrewed flight and 2030 for a crewed mission. Technical challenges, including Starship failures and delays in mastering in-space propellant refuelling, have contributed to this shift.

title: 2025 NFL preseason schedule: Where to watch, teams, weeks, dates, times
content: NFL enthusiasts are eagerly awaiting the 2025 season, with the preseason games acting as a thrilling prelude. Starting August 7, the three-week preseason schedule showcases all 32 teams. The Philadelphia Eagles, fresh off their Super Bowl LIX victory, will clash with the Dallas Cowboys on September 4, marking the season's official kickoff.

title: Trade war: Trump's 'reciprocal' tariffs go into effect today - check full list of countries
content: US President Trump's new tariffs, effective Thursday, impose higher duties on exports from over 60 countries, including India. A 25% tariff on Indian goods, totaling 50%, is a consequence of India's Russian oil purchases, deemed a national security threat. Brazil also faces a 50% tariff, while others like Canada and the UK have varying rates.

title: EXPOSED! Kerala govt said they won't spend on inviting Messi, RTI reply says differently
content: The Kerala government's plan to bring Lionel Messi to Kerala has sparked controversy. Sports Minister V. Abdurahiman's Spain trip, costing Rs 13 lakh, contradicts earlier assurances that no public funds would be used for the invitation. Despite the minister's efforts and Argentina's popularity in Kerala, the visit is now unlikely due to scheduling issues.

title: Odisha student immolates self after threats from ex — 4th such case
content: In Kendrapada, a college student allegedly died by suicide. Her former boyfriend threatened to release private photos. The father blames police inaction. He claims the police did not file a complaint earlier. Instead, they advised blocking the number. An investigation is underway. Police assure accountability if negligence is found. Opposition parties demand immediate arrest.

title: 'Unzipped his pants': Gurgaon woman recounts horror while waiting for cab
content: A Gurgaon woman has filed a police complaint alleging sexual harassment near Rajiv Chowk. She claims a man unzipped his pants and masturbated in front of her while she waited for a cab. The police initially refused to register her complaint online, and the women's helpline went unanswered.

title: Save the date! Virat Kohli and Rohit to make India comeback
content: Indian cricket stars Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to play in the ODI series against Australia in October. This marks their return to international cricket after retiring from Test matches. The first match will be in Perth on October 19. Subsequent matches are scheduled for Adelaide and Sydney.

title: Duleep Trophy: After impressive captaincy debut in England, Gill to lead NZ
content: Shubman Gill, fresh off his impressive captaincy in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, is set to lead North Zone in the upcoming Duleep Trophy, commencing August 28 in Bengaluru. Gill's stellar performance against England included amassing 754 runs, surpassing Gavaskar's record for most runs by an Indian captain in a five-Test series.

title: Blue Jays total 45 runs, 63 hits in sweep of Rox
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. had four hits, including a home run, and the Blue Jays finished off a three-game sweep of the Rockies in which they had 63 hits and scored 45 runs.

title: Judge tosses 1983 NC State team's suit vs. NCAA
content: A North Carolina judge has dismissed a lawsuit filed by the 1983 NC State men's basketball team, shutting down the national championship winner's request for NIL compensation.

title: IndyCar perplexed by ICE 'Speedway' imagery
content: IndyCar driver Pato O'Ward and series officials were shocked by a social media post from the Department of Homeland Security that touted plans for an immigration detention center in Indiana dubbed the "Speedway Slammer."

title: Kittredge, booed a day ago, has immaculate inning
content: Less than a day after he was booed off the mound in a loss to the Reds, Cubs reliever Andrew Kittredge threw an immaculate inning Wednesday, Chicago's first since 2022.

title: NFLPA gets clarity: Players' own smelling salts OK
content: The NFL clarified a memo sent to clubs on Tuesday, saying players will still be able to whiff smelling salts during games this season as long as the team doesn't provide them.

title: Son signs deal, calls MLS move 'dream come true'
content: LAFC's blockbuster summer signing Son Heung-Min said his move to the MLS club is a "dream come true" after a 10-year run with Tottenham Hotspur.

title: Day: Ohio State QB battle to go 'down to the wire'
content: Ohio State's quarterback competition between Julian Sayin and Lincoln Kienholz remains too close to call, coach Ryan Day says.

title: Red Sox sign rookie Anthony to 8-year extension
content: Rookie Roman Anthony has signed an eight-year extension with the Red Sox. The deal is worth $130 million and could escalate as high as $230 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Is it time to worry about Caleb Williams and the Bears?
content: Caleb Williams has been frustrated, Ben Johnson has been blunt, but are things as bleak as they appear?

title: Bring on the reinforcements! Returning players who could swing MLB's playoff races
content: These injured stars expected to come off the IL could prove as good as any trade deadline blockbuster.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 1.0: Early picks for Pochettino's team
content: With players focusing on the looming European club season, nine months remain before World Cup squads are announced. Who will be on the U.S.'s?

title: When will Cooper Flagg be an All-Star? Projecting the No. 1 pick's NBA future
content: How many MVPs and titles for Cooper Flagg? When can Dallas expect success with him? ESPN experts predict his NBA future.

title: The 192 players who should be rostered in 12-team leagues
content: Ranking the players who should be drafted in 12-team leagues, divided into tiers, but it can be useful for leagues of all sizes.

title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's dad prepared him for the big moments. None will be bigger than 2025
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: 'Raw end of the stick': Taurasi opens up on being benched for Olympic gold medal game in new documentary
content: A new docuseries sheds light on key parts of the retired star's WNBA, Olympic and overseas basketball career.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 running backs in Madden NFL 26
content: Jahmyr Gibbs, Christian McCaffrey and others are near the top of Madden NFL 26's running back rankings.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Dolidze vs. Hernandez
content: MMA expert Din Thomas picks Dolidze vs. Hernandez and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Ballon d'Or: 10 nominated players you may have missed since 2014
content: Napoli midfielder Scott McTominay earned himself a place on the short list for the 2025 Ballon d'Or award, but which other under-the-radar players made it over the past decade?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye move for PSG star Bradley Barcola
content: Liverpool could make another blockbuster move to sign Bradley Barcola from Paris Saint-Germain. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 11: The final weekend
content: Three teams have clinched playoff bids. Who else will qualify? Here's how the teams line up heading into Boston.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Looking for late-season heroes? Six players to target
content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: Conclave to mark golden jubilee of Scheduled Tribes Development department: Minister
content: Delivers inaugural address at national seminar on ‘Glimpses of tribal life: Knowledge and Intangible expressions’ at Loyola College of Social Sciences

title: Man held for triple murder in Kakinada
content: The lorry driver resorted to extreme step after his wife had learnt about his extramarital affair with the victim, who reportedly insisted him to continue the affair.

title: EC acting beyond its jurisdiction, says Trinamool MP Abhishek Banerjee
content: His remarks come a day after Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said she will not let the poll body suspend any government official in Bengal

title: Calicut varsity ties up with coop. tech company to develop supercapacitors
content: Collaboration with Malabar Co-op Tech aimed at taking a breakthrough material developed entirely in India from the lab to real-world applications

title: School students at Erattupetta rekindles career dream of Ranganathan
content: Ranganathan, a Theni native, does odd jobs in the Pala–Erattupetta region, despite PG and MEd qualifications. Hearing his story, authorities of Erattupetta Government Higher Secondary School extended him an invitation to give a motivational talk to the students

title: Wayanad landslides call for community-based early warning systems, says Japanese disaster management expert
content: The report identifies a lethal mix of factors behind the tragedy, including extreme rainfall of 409 mm in 24 hours and human-induced vulnerabilities

title: Shiromani Akali Dal leader Naresh Gujral backs PM Modi on India’s stand amid U.S. tensions
content: Mr. Gujral’s comments are prescient in light of the fact that SAD had exited the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance in 2020 in amid the protests against the contentious farm laws

title: Kerala State Electricity Board kicks off smart meter roll-out under alternative implementation model
content: Smart meters will be installed for govt. consumers, HT consumers, on distribution transformers, 11 kV and 22 kV feeders, and at Electrical Division boundaries of KSEB in the first phase

title: Siddaramaiah attacks Modi over Trump’s tariff, calls it a result of ‘prioritising headline management over real diplomacy and national interest’
content: The Chief Minister describes the tariffs as ‘economic blackmail’;  ‘India must uphold its strategic autonomy with dignity — not surrender it for photo-ops,’ he says

title: Vande Bharat Express regular service from Monday
content: The new service with Nos 26752 and 26751 will be flagged off from Bengaluru by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday

title: Lok Sabha passes Manipur Appropriation Bill amid Opposition din
content: Manipur Goods and Services Tax (Amendment) Bill, 2025 also passed by voice vote; appropriations Bill lets State, under President’s Rule, draw ₹30,969 cr for its expenditure requirements for the current year

title: "Their Mistake": Tejashwi Yadav's Dig At Poll Body Over 2 EPIC Numbers
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday charged the election authorities in Patna with faulting him for their "own mistake" by sending him a notice on having two EPIC numbers.

title: Timelapse Video: Army Builds Bridge To Connect Forward Areas In Arunachal
content: In a remarkable feat of engineering and determination, the Spear Corps of the Indian Army successfully launched a 110-foot bridge across the Kundao-Chu River, establishing a crucial link between the strategically important areas.

title: "In Australia, Media Made Us Villains": Gautam Adani On Queensland Coal Mine
content: In one of the most candid public reflections of his career, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Wednesday spoke at length about the storm of global criticism and coordinated resistance his group faced over the Carmichael coal project in Australia.

title: "In Australia, Media Made Us Villains": Gautam Adani On Carmichael Coal Project
content: In one of the most candid public reflections of his career, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Wednesday spoke at length about the storm of global criticism and coordinated resistance his group faced over the Carmichael coal project in Australia.

title: "In Australia, Media Made Us Villains": Gautam Adani On Carmichael Coal Project
content: In one of the most candid public reflections of his career, Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Wednesday spoke at length about the storm of global criticism and coordinated resistance his group faced over the Carmichael coal project in Australia.

title: US Consulate In Hyderabad Gets New Consul General
content: The US Consulate General in Hyderabad has a new leader at the helm. Laura E Williams, a seasoned diplomat with a strong background in technology and innovation, has been appointed as the new US Consul General, effective today.

title: Fake Odisha Doctor Killed, Buried Over Witchcraft Suspicion, 8 Detained
content: A man was allegedly killed by a group of villagers and buried in a forest on suspicion of practising witchcraft in Odisha's Gajapati district, police said on Thursday.

title: Kamal Haasan Meets PM Modi, Seeks Recognition For Antiquity Of Archaeological Site Keeladi
content: Actor-politician Kamal Haasan met Prime Minister Narendra Modi today - a first since taking oath as a Rajya Sabha MP -- and made a strong pitch for the recognition of the Keeladi archaeological findings.

title: Sudan Airstrike Kills 40 Suspected Mercenaries At Darfur Airport
content: A Sudanese airstrike hit an airport in the country's Darfur region controlled by a notorious paramilitary group, destroying a suspected Emirati military aircraft and killing dozens of suspected mercenaries.

title: Donald Trump 'Applies' For Bihar Residence Certificate, Officials File FIR
content: An online application seeking a residence certificate in the name of US President Donald Trump has surfaced in Bihar's Samastipur district. Officials flagged the attempt as fraudand have lodged an FIR to trace the person behind the hoax.

title: Rare Barbary Lions, Extinct In The Wild, Born At Czech Zoo
content: Four Barbary lion cubs were born recently in a Czech zoo, a vital contribution to a small surviving population of the rare lion that is extinct in the wild.

title: NDTV Ground Report From Uttarakhand Army Camp Where 9 Are Missing
content: Broken asbestos sheets, upturned cars, boulders all around present the grim picture of an Army camp devastated by the Uttarakhand flash floods.

title: Kashmir Mediation To Russian Oil: Trump's 'Un'Truth Social
content: US President Donald Trump has made several misleading or outright inaccurate statements about India -- from falsehoods regarding trade policy to the economy, Trump's remarks have frequently clashed with facts.

title: Watch: Bihar School Gives Unique 'Bride-Style' Farewell To Teachers
content: A middle school in Bihar's Begusarai gave two of its teachers a unique and emotional farewell. Students and school staff united to honour the departing educators, and it was nothing short of a traditional vidaai - send-off of a bride.

title: Deals, Drama, And Delusion: Trump's Return To World Stage Full Of Tamasha
content: US President Donald Trump's second term in office is not turning out any different than his first - marked less by diplomacy, but more by drama, officials have said. Mr Trump's style, laced with unpredictability, misinformation and showmanship.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Syria's Druze Community, Bombed By Israel, Has A Curious 'India' Link
content: The massacre of the Druze minority by Islamist and government forces provided Israel with an excuse to again start bombing Damascus. This time, Israel may have the overt consent of many countries, both in the region and beyond.

title: "Stay In Your Lane, India": Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal's Solution To 50% Trump Tariffs
content: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal has hit back at US' sudden tariff hike on Indian imports, calling on India to rise as an "unapologetic superpower" in the face of global pressure.

title: "Will start on August 29": Maratha Quota Activist Announces New Protest From Mumbai
content: Activist Manoj Jarange has said he will launch a fresh agitation on August 29 in Mumbai to press for his demand for reservation for the Maratha community.

title: Crackdown On Quacks In Telangana, 500 Police Cases Filed
content: A massive and unprecedented crackdown on fake doctors across the state has been started, with the Telangana Medical Council asking the police to file around 500 FIRs in an effort to safeguard public health.

title: ‘Ignored’ by authorities, landslip victims of Vilangad an aggrieved lot
content: A year into the series of landslips that ravaged their lives,  120 families of Vilangad in Kozhikode district are waiting for relief and reconstruction activities to take off in their village. Aabha Raveendran meets some of the survivors of the disaster, who believe that the Wayanad landslides, which claimed a large number of lives and left a trail of destruction, have overshadowed their plight

title: Call for creating extensive awareness on child marriage, teenage pregnancy, rape
content: The Chairperson of Karnataka State Commission for Women has directed officials to reach out to all colleges for the purpose

title: TDP MPs urge Union Steel Minister to expedite  approvals for ArcelorMittal-Nippon Steel plant in Andhra Pradesh’s Anakapalli district
content: They want Kumaraswamy’s intervention in speedy allocation of iron ore by the NMDC and laying of slurry pipeline

title: CPI State meet at Ongole from Aug. 20 will rigorously debate ‘anti-people’ policies, says Ramakrishna
content: The event will be a platform to intensify agitations and unite democratic and leftist forces, the party State secretary announces

title: Use scientific research to promote sustainable use and conservation of natural resources: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Kerala Science Award 2023 presented to S. Somanath, former chairman of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) at R&D Summit organised by Kerala State Council for Science, Technology and Environment

title: India’s first PEVC centre of excellence inaugurated at IIMB
content: The centre aims at becoming a catalyst for thought leadership, talent development, and innovation in the world of PEVC

title: Why can’t Tamil Nadu government fulfil RTE obligation without waiting for central funds under Samagra Shiksha Scheme, asks Madras High Court
content: Justices G.R. Swaminathan and V. Lakshminarayanan raise the question during the hearing of a contempt of court petition filed against School Education Secretary B. Chandra Mohan

title: Rahul's claims on poll rigging baseless: Eknath Shinde
content: Eknath Shinde asserted that the MahaYuti government was committed to public welfare and the people approved of various initiatives taken by the government, which was also reflected in the landslide victory of the ruling alliance

title: Future course on BC reservations to be decided after PAC meet: Revanth
content: State government is ready to conduct an official meeting at the Secretariat, and Union Minister G. Kishan Reddy and the Minister of Social Justice and Empowerment can attend to know content of the BC Bills, the Chief Minister said

title: More film festivals likely in Kozhikode in coming years
content: Kerala State Chalachithra Academy is proactively considering the demand, says its Secretary C. Ajoy; Mayor Beena Philip mentions that steps will be taken to arrange at least 25 screens in the city in two years

title: Gujarat registers over 5 lakh ‘Lakhpati Didis’, sets target of 10 lakh women entrepreneurs
content: The scheme supports rural women associated with self-help groups (SHGs) to start income-generating activities in agriculture, animal husbandry, trade, manufacturing, and services; it was launched in 2023 with the aim to support 3 crore women across India by 2027

title: Empowering SCs, STs through guidance on international education prospects
content: Regional Centre of VTU hosts orientation programme in Kalaburagi for students throwing light on govt.-supported scholarship schemes

title: Don’t bend to the U.S.’s threats, Left parties urge Centre
content: The U.S. and the EU are attempting to arm twist countries like India for continuing trade relations with Russia, even as they themselves continue to trade with Russia, the CPI (M) said in a statement

title: CM announces free power, ₹25,000 annual aid for A.P. weavers
content: Chandrababu Naidu also announces reimbursement of up to 5% of GST on handloom products, setting up of Handloom Museum in Amaravati, and observance of birth anniversary of former MP Pragada Kotaiah, who spearheaded the handloom movement, as a State function

title: NDA leaders authorise PM, Nadda to pick alliance candidate for Vice President
content: Candidate likely to be announced on August 12; sources say choice likely to be from the BJP, within PM’s circle of trust; if all NDA MPs vote for alliance candidate on September 9, it has the strength to win

title: Aster to invest ₹580 crore to set up 500-bedded hospital in Yeshwanthpur
content: New investment reflects the healthcare firm’s asset-light expansion approach, using Built-to-Suit models to deliver world-class healthcare infrastructure in high-demand corridors, says Azad Moopen, founder and chairman, Aster DM

title: Repair works begin on Surathkal-Nanthoor stretch of NH 66
content: The works would be taken up during off-peak hours, that is, between 11 a.m. and 3 p.m., and also at night

title: Monsoon session of Andhra Pradesh Legislature likely in September
content: The session may be convened for one week to pass certain Bills and amendments to several Acts, and discuss development and welfare schemes

title: Basavaraj Deshmukh, among 15, chosen for Basava Puraskar
content: He has been chosen in recognition of his outstanding contribution to education and also, social service

title: Bengaluru stadium stampede: Government submits inquiry commission’s report to Karnataka High Court
content: A Division Bench, on August 5, directed the government to submit the report while hearing a petition filed by DNA, the event management partner of Royal Challengers Sports which owns RCB cricket team

title: Attack on four independent journalists in Dharmasthala condemned
content: The Forum of Progressive Organisations terms the assault as an attempt to ‘silence truth and intimidate the media’

title: Validity of fire NOC extended to five years amidst growing concerns on safety rule violations
content: Move as part of the State Business Reform Action Plan-2024. A section of experienced Fire and Rescue Service personnel has described it as “disappointing” and called for a thorough review by the State government

title: Constable with Karnataka State Reserve Police falls victim to dating app scam, loses ₹28.2 lakh
content: Police suspect that this can be a case of sextortion, and the victim could have been blackmailed, which he was not acknowledging because of humiliation and fear of backlash from the department

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Cause of disaster still unclear with sites difficult to access
content: Experts have thus far characterised ‘extremely heavy rainfall’ from August 3-5 as a probable cause, but not a cloudburst, which is a more extreme form of rainfall that’s challenging to confirm or forecast

title: BJP’s only national spokesperson from Northeast Mmhonlumo Kikon resigns
content: Mmhonlumo Kikon steps down, cites need to ‘recalibrate journey’ in letter to BJP president J.P. Nadda

title: Brother alleges foul play in Bindhu Padmanabhan’s disappearance
content: She went missing from Kadakarappally in Alappuzha in 2006. Role of Sebastian, who was arrested by the Kottayam Crime Branch recently in a murder case, suspected in her disappearance

title: Canara Engineering College of Mangaluru gets autonomous status
content: The college is managed by 134-year-old Canara High School Assocation of Mangaluru. The autonomy is valid till 2034-35.

title: U.S. tariffs: ‘We should also raise it to 50%,’ says Shashi Tharoor
content: “It will definitely have an impact because we have a trade of $90 billion with them and if everything becomes 50% more expensive buyers will also think why should they buy Indian things? If they do this, we should also impose a 50% tariff on American exports,” Mr. Tharoor said
